topic: How to design WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to design WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Designing WebAssembly (WASM) Targets using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides an overview of how to create WebAssembly (WASM) targets utilizing FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understand the benefits and use cases of WebAssembly
Familiarize yourself with FastAPI – a popular web framework in Python 3.12+
Learn how to set up a new FastAPI project for WASM target creation
Explore the process of converting Python code to WebAssembly modules
Understand the role of the pyodide library in bridging the gap between Python and WebAssembly
Discover how to deploy and run your WASM FastAPI application

code_examples.code:
import pyodide
# (...) pyodide setup and imports (...) 
some_function = pyodide.run_pyodide(some_python_function)

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this tutorial
FastAPI version should be compatible with Python 3.12
caveats: Pyodide is still in beta, so some limitations and incompatibilities may arise
Ensure you have a modern web browser supporting WebAssembly for testing and deployment purposes
